title: Grade 1 English Language Arts
teaser: Core Knowledge Language Arts Listening and Learning, and Skills

children.title: Core Knowledge Language Arts, Listening and Learning
children.teaser: Students build the background knowledge and vocabulary critical to listening and reading comprehension.

children.title: Fables and Stories
children.teaser: Students work on vocabulary and comprehension skills, and become familiar with the structure of a story.

children.title: The Boy Who Cried Wolf
children.teaser: Students identify the characters, setting, and plot of "The Boy Who Cried Wolf"

children.title: The Maid and the Milk Pail
children.teaser: Students identify the characters, setting, and plot of "The Maid and the Milk Pail"

children.title: The Goose and the Golden Eggs
children.teaser: Students identify the characters, setting, and plot of "The Goose and the Golden Egg"

children.title: The Dog in the Manger
children.teaser: Using "The Dog in the Manger," students identify what constitutes a fable.

children.title: The Wolf in Sheep’s Clothing
children.teaser: Students continue to explore the characteristics of fable using "The Wolf in Sheep's Clothing"

children.title: The Fox and the Grapes
children.teaser: Students continue to explore the characteristics of fable using "The Fox and the Grapes"

children.title: The Little Half-Chick (Medio Pollito)
children.teaser: Students study the characteristics of a folktale using “The Little Half-Chick (Medio Pollito)”

children.title: The Crowded, Noisy House
children.teaser: Students explore the characteristics of "The Crowded, Noisy House"

children.title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
children.teaser: Students describe the characteristics of "A Tale of Peter Rabbit"

children.title: All Stories Are Anansi’s
children.teaser: Students study the characteristics of a folktale using "All Stories are Anansi's"

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Fables and Stories

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Fables and Stories

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Fables and Stories

children.title: The Human Body
children.teaser: Students are introduced to a network of body systems that work together to keep us alive.

children.title: Everybody Has a Body
children.teaser: Students understand that the human body is made up of a network of systems

children.title: The Body’s Framework
children.teaser: Students begin to explore those body systems with the skeletal system.

children.title: Marvelous Moving Muscles
children.teaser: Students continue their exploration and understanding with the muscular system, including the heart.

children.title: Chew, Swallow, Squeeze, and Churn
children.teaser: Students learn about the digestive system.

children.title: The Body’s Superhighway
children.teaser: Students learn about the circulatory system.

children.title: Control Central: The Brain
children.teaser: Students learn about how the nervous system is the body's control center.

children.title: Dr. Welbody’s Heroes
children.teaser: Students learn about the concept of vaccination.

children.title: Five Keys to Health
children.teaser: Students learn about how to keep a body healthy, through exercise and vaccination.

children.title: The Pyramid Pantry
children.teaser: Students learn about keeping healthy through a balanced diet.

children.title: What a Complicated Network!
children.teaser: Students learn about how the body systems function together best when we keep ourselves healthy.

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of The Human Body

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of The Human Body

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for The Human Body

children.title: Different Lands, Similar Stories
children.teaser: Students study folktales from different countries and cultures that have similar themes and messages.

children.title: Cinderella
children.teaser: Students study the components of a story using "Cinderella"

children.title: The Girl with the Red Slippers
children.teaser: Students explore similarities between "Cinderella" and "The Girl with the Red Slippers"

children.title: Billy Beg
children.teaser: Students continue to explore fiction using "Billy Beg"

children.title: Tom Thumb
children.teaser: Students continue to learn about characters, plot, and setting using "Tom Thumb"

children.title: Thumbelina
children.teaser: Students identify similarities between previous stories and "Thumbelina"

children.title: Issun Boshi: One-Inch Boy
children.teaser: Students identify similarities between previous stories and "Issun Boshi: One-inch Boy"

children.title: Little Red Riding Hood
children.teaser: Students explore "Little Red Riding Hood," examining character, plot, and setting.

children.title: Hu Gu Po
children.teaser: Students describe the characters, plot, and setting of “Hu Gu Po”

children.title: Tselane
children.teaser: Students dive into "Tselane" and discuss how different cultures address similar themes

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Different Lands, Similar Stories

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Different Lands, Similar Stories

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Different Lands, Similar Stories

children.title: Early World Civilizations
children.teaser: Students explore how and where civilizations, governments, writing and religion form.

children.title: A Father and His Son in Mesopotamia
children.teaser: Students learn, through an historical fiction vignette in Mesopotamia, how rivers support civilizations.

children.title: Writing in Mesopotamia
children.teaser: Students explore reading, writing, and laws in Mesopotamia, examining the Code of Hammurabi

children.title: The Religion of Babylon
children.teaser: Students learn about the significance of gods, ziggurats, and priests in ancient Mesopotamia

children.title: The Hanging Gardens of Babylon
children.teaser: Students understand the importance of the Tigris and Euphrates rivers as the Cradle of Civilization

children.title: People of the Nile
children.teaser: Students continue to learn to identify geographic locations on maps, turning their focus to Egypt.

children.title: Writing in Ancient Egypt
children.teaser: Students learn, through studying Egyptian hieroglyphs, how written language is important to civilizations

children.title: Amon-Ra and the Gods of Ancient Egypt
children.teaser: Students will be able to locate Egypt on a map and explore the gods of ancient Egypt

children.title: Approaching the Great Pyramid
children.teaser: Students will study the pyramids.

children.title: The Sphinx
children.teaser: Students will learn that Egypt is located in the desert of Africa, and explore the mystery of the Sphinx

children.title: The Story of Hatshepsut
children.teaser: Students will learn about Hatshepsut, a female pharaoh of ancient Egypt

children.title: Tutankhamun, The Golden Pharaoh, Part I
children.teaser: Students will learn about archaeology through the exploration of King Tut

children.title: Tutankhamun, The Golden Pharaoh, Part II
children.teaser: Students will continue to learn about King Tutankhamun

children.title: Three World Religions
children.teaser: Students will identify Judaism, Christianity, and Islam as major monotheistic world religions

children.title: Judaism
children.teaser: Students study the origins of Judaism.

children.title: Christianity
children.teaser: Students study the origins of Christianity

children.title: Islam
children.teaser: Students study the origins of Islam

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Early World Civilizations

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Early World Civilizations

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Early World Civilizations

children.title: Early American Civilizations
children.teaser: Students will examine the fundamental features of the Maya, Aztec, and Inca

children.title: The Maya: A Harvest and a Hurricane
children.teaser: Students will study the Mayan society, including farming and family

children.title: The Maya: Journey to Baakal
children.teaser: Students will understand where the Mayan Empire was located

children.title: The Maya: King Pakal’s Tomb
children.teaser: Students will explore the leadership structure of the Mayan Empire

children.title: The Maya: The Festival of the First Star
children.teaser: Students will explore the how the stars and planets impacted the Mayan calendar

children.title: The Aztec: The Legend of the Eagle and the Serpent
children.teaser: Students will shift to studying the Aztecs and their civilization

children.title: The Aztec: The Floating Gardens of Xochimilco
children.teaser: Students will understand where the Aztec Empire was located

children.title: The Aztec: In the Palace of an Emperor
children.teaser: Students will study the emperors of the Aztecs and its capitol

children.title: The Aztec: Cortés’s Letter
children.teaser: Students will continue to learn about the Aztecs, where they were located, and what they believed.

children.title: The Inca: Who Were the Inca?
children.teaser: Students will begin to explore the Incas and where they lived.

children.title: The Inca: The Runner
children.teaser: Students will learn about how the Inca lived.

children.title: The Inca: Machu Picchu— A Lucky Discovery
children.teaser: Students will learn about Machu Picchu and archaeology

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Early American Civilizations

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Early American Civilizations

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Early American Civilizations

children.title: Astronomy
children.teaser: Students will study our place in the solar system

children.title: Introduction to the Sun and Space
children.teaser: Students will begin to explore the sun and how it supports life

children.title: The Earth and the Sun
children.teaser: Students will begin to understand the Earth, its rotation, and its connection to day and night.

children.title: Stars
children.teaser: Students will study the sun as a star.

children.title: Stargazing and Constellations
children.teaser: Students will learn about how telescopes help us to understand the moon, stars, and constellations.

children.title: The Moon
children.teaser: Students will study the four phases of the moon.

children.title: History of Space Exploration and Astronauts
children.teaser: Students will study astronauts.

children.title: Exploration of the Moon
children.teaser: Students will learn about how astronauts landed on the moon.

children.title: The Solar System, Part I
children.teaser: Students will learn about the planets in our solar system

children.title: The Solar System, Part II
children.teaser: Students will continue to learn about our solar system.

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Astronomy

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Astronomy

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Astronomy

children.title: The History of the Earth
children.teaser: Students will learn about the geographical features of the Earth, from the layers to fascinating functions .

children.title: Our Home, Earth
children.teaser: Students will learn about oceans and continents, and how scientists grow our understanding.

children.title: The Earth Inside-Out, Part I
children.teaser: Students focus on the layers of the Earth, including the crust.

children.title: The Earth Inside-Out, Part II
children.teaser: Students learn about the Earth's mantle, volcanoes, and how heat, pressure and time change the Earth

children.title: The Earth Inside-Out, Part III
children.teaser: Students will explore volcanoes and geysers.

children.title: Minerals
children.teaser: Students learn about the common minerals of the Earth.

children.title: The Three Types of Rocks
children.teaser: Students identify the three types of rocks.

children.title: Fossils
children.teaser: Students will learn about fossils.

children.title: Dinosaurs
children.teaser: Students will learn about the dinosaurs

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of The History of the Earth

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of The History of the Earth

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for The History of the Earth

children.title: Animals and Habitats
children.teaser: Students will study the interconnectedness of all living things in the natural world, with a focus on habitat.

children.title: What is a Habitat?
children.teaser: Students will learn about what a habitat is.

children.title: Animals of the Arctic Habitat
children.teaser: Students will explore different habitats, beginning with the Arctic Tundra and Arctic Ocean

children.title: Animals of the Sonoran Desert Habitat
children.teaser: Students learn about the desert habitats, and they will classify animals according to foods they eat

children.title: Animals of the East African Savanna Habitat
children.teaser: Students will learn about the grassland habitat.

children.title: Animals of the Temperate Deciduous Forest Habitat
children.teaser: Students will learn about the animals in the temperate deciduous forest habitat

children.title: Animals of the Tropical Rainforest Habitat
children.teaser: Students will learn about adaptations and the tropical rainforest habitat

children.title: Animals of the Freshwater Habitat
children.teaser: Students will learn how to discern between fresh and saltwater habitats, with a focus on freshwater

children.title: Animals of the Saltwater Habitat
children.teaser: Students will study the diversity of the ocean.

children.title: Habitat Destruction and Endangered Species
children.teaser: Students will focus on how habitat destruction can cause extinction.

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Animals and Habitats

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Animals and Habitats

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Animals and Habitats

children.title: Fairy Tales
children.teaser: Students will begin to learn about how fairy tales are different from other types of fiction

children.title: Sleeping Beauty
children.teaser: Students will use "Sleeping Beauty" to study common characteristics of fairy tales

children.title: Rumpelstiltskin
children.teaser: Students will use "Rumpelstiltskin" to study common characteristics of fairy tales

children.title: Rapunzel
children.teaser: Students learn about "Rapunzel," and compare different adaptations of fairy tales

children.title: The Frog Prince, Part I
children.teaser: Students will become familiar with "The Frog Prince" fairy tale

children.title: The Frog Prince, Part II
children.teaser: Students will continue to study fairy tales using "The Frog Prince"

children.title: Hansel and Gretel, Part I
children.teaser: Students will continue to learn about the elements of fairy tales using "Hansel and Gretel"

children.title: Hansel and Gretel, Part II
children.teaser: Students will continue to work with "Hansel and Gretel"

children.title: Jack and the Beanstalk, Part I
children.teaser: Students will learn about the fairy tale elements of "Jack and the Beanstalk"

children.title: Jack and the Beanstalk, Part II
children.teaser: Students will continue to read "Jack and the Beanstalk," identifying the common characteristics of fairy tales

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Fairy Tales

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Fairy Tales

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Fairy Tales

children.title: A New Nation: American Independence
children.teaser: Students study how the stories of historical figures contributed to the formation of the United States.

children.title: The New World
children.teaser: Students study how the United States came to be, including indentured servitude, colonization, and independence.

children.title: A Taxing Time: The Boston Tea Party
children.teaser: Students learn about the thirteen colonies and the Boston Tea Party

children.title: The Shot Heard Round the World
children.teaser: Students learn about Paul Revere's Ride

children.title: Declaring Independence
children.teaser: Students learn about the contributions of the Founding Fathers

children.title: The Legend of Betsy Ross
children.teaser: Students learn about the legend of Betsy Ross and the flag

children.title: George Washington, Commander in Chief
children.teaser: Students learn about the contributions of George Washington as a military commander

children.title: Will This War Never End?
children.teaser: Students learn about the contributions of George Washington as a military commander

children.title: A Young Nation is Born
children.teaser: Students learn about the contributions of George Washington as a president

children.title: Never Leave Until Tomorrow What You Can Do Today
children.teaser: Students learn about Benjamin Franklin.

children.title: Building a Nation with Words and Ideas
children.teaser: Students learn about the contributions of Thomas Jefferson

children.title: Liberty and Justice for ALL?
children.teaser: Students explore the roles of African Americans, Native Americans, and women in the early United States

children.title: What Do a Flag, a Bell, and an Eagle Have in Common?
children.teaser: Students learn about symbols of the nation.

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of A New Nation: American Independence

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of A New Nation: American Independence

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for A New Nation: American Independence

children.title: Frontier Explorers
children.teaser: Students learn about  early westward expansion of the United States.

children.title: Daniel Boone and the Opening of the West
children.teaser: Students learn about Daniel Boone's contribution to opening the west.

children.title: Crossing the Appalachian Mountains
children.teaser: Students learn about the Wilderness Road

children.title: Jefferson and Monroe
children.teaser: Students become familiar with the geographic landmarks of the US, like the Mississippi and the Rockies.

children.title: The Louisiana Purchase
children.teaser: Students understand the significance of the Louisiana Purchase

children.title: Lewis and Clark
children.teaser: Students understand that there were already civilizations living in the territories of Louisiana.

children.title: Lewis and Clark: The Journey Begins
children.teaser: Students learn about some of the tribes living in the territory when Lewis and Clark began their expedition.

children.title: Discovery and Danger on the Prairie
children.teaser: Students learn about Lewis and Clark's encounters with Native Americans during the expedition

children.title: Sacagawea
children.teaser: Students learn about Sacagawea's relationship with Lewis and Clark

children.title: Red Cedars and Grizzly Bears
children.teaser: Students learn about what motivated Lewis and Clark to embark on the expedition.

children.title: Rivers and Mountains
children.teaser: Students learn about how Sacagewea, Lewis and Clark worked together during the expedition.

children.title: To the Pacific and Back
children.teaser: Students learn about how Sacagewea, Lewis and Clark worked together during the expedition.

children.title: Domain Review
children.teaser: Review of Frontier Explorers

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Frontier Explorers

children.title: Culminating Activities
children.teaser: Culminating Activities for Frontier Explorers

children.title: Core Knowledge Language Arts, Skills
children.teaser: Students learn the decoding skills needed for reading.

children.title: Blending and Segmenting, Tricky Words, and Spelling
children.teaser: Students will review sounds and spellings as well as read decodable stories from Snap Shots.

children.title: Sounds /p/, /k/, /g/, /n/, /a/ Spelled ‘p’—‘P’, ‘c’—‘C’, ‘g’—‘G’, ‘n’—‘N’, ‘a’—‘A’
children.teaser: Students will work with Sounds /p/, /k/, /g/, /n/, /a/ Spelled ‘p’—‘P’, ‘c’—‘C’, ‘g’—‘G’, ‘n’—‘N’, ‘a’—‘A’

children.title: Sounds /i/, /o/, /t/, /d/ Spelled ‘i’—‘I’, ‘o’—‘O’, ‘t’—‘T’, ‘d’—‘D’
children.teaser: Students will work with sounds /i/, /o/, /t/, /d/ Spelled ‘i’—‘I’, ‘o’—‘O’, ‘t’—‘T’, ‘d’—‘D’

children.title: Tricky Words: a, I; Grammar: Nouns
children.teaser: Students will study tricky words and nouns

children.title: Sounds /m/, /f/, /v/ Spelled ‘m’—‘M’, ‘f’—‘F’, ‘v’—‘V’
children.teaser: Students will learn the /m/, /f/, and /v/ sounds, along with their representations

children.title: Sounds /s/, /z/, /h/ Spelled ‘s’—‘S’, ‘z’—‘Z’, ‘h’—‘H’; Tricky Words: no, so, of
children.teaser: Students will learn /s/, /z/, and /h/, with tricky words no, so, and of.

children.title: Word Recognition Assessment
children.teaser: Students will be assessed on word recognition

children.title: Reading Assessment
children.teaser: Reading assessment

children.title: Reading Assessment
children.teaser: Reading assessment

children.title: Reading Assessment
children.teaser: Reading assessment

children.title: Reading Assessment
children.teaser: Reading assessment

children.title: Sister Sounds /s/ and /z/, /f/ and /v/; Tricky Words: is, to
children.teaser: Students will learn about sister sounds /s/ and /z/; /f/ and /v/, as well as tricky words "is" and "to"

children.title: Sounds /b/, /l/, /r/ Spelled ‘b’—‘B’, ‘l’—‘L’, ‘r’—‘R’
children.teaser: Students will learn /b/, /l/, and /r/

children.title: Sounds /w/, /e/, /u/ Spelled ‘w’—‘W’, ‘e’—‘E’, ‘u’—‘U’; Tricky Words: all, some
children.teaser: Students will learn /w/, /e/, and /u/, with "all" and "some"

children.title: Grammar: Nouns; Tricky Words: from, word
children.teaser: Students will focus on tricky words "from" and "word"

children.title: Sounds /j/, /y/ Spelled ‘j’—‘J’, ‘y’—‘Y’; Tricky Words: are, have, were
children.teaser: Students will learn /j/ and /y/; "are" "have" and "were"

children.title: Sounds /x/, /k/ Spelled ‘x’—’X’, ‘k’—’K’; Tricky Words: one, once
children.teaser: Students will learn /x/ and /k/; "one" and "once"

children.title: Sounds /ch/, /sh/ Spelled ‘ch’, ‘sh’; Grammar: Nouns; Tricky Words: do, two
children.teaser: Students will learn /ch/ and /sh/; as well as "do" and "two"

children.title: Sister Sounds /th/ and /th/
children.teaser: Students will learn /th/ sister sounds

children.title: Tricky Words: the, who
children.teaser: Students will learn tricky words "the" and "who"

children.title: Tricky Words: said, says; Sounds /ng/, /qu/ Spelled ‘ng’, ‘qu’
children.teaser: Students will learn tricky words "said" and "says"; and /ng/ and /qu/

children.title: Vowel Sound Review
children.teaser: Students will review vowel sounds using mirror

children.title: Vowel and Consonant Sound Review; Grammar: Nouns
children.teaser: Students will continue to review vowel sounds and consonants

children.title: Sounds /k/, /b/, /d/, /f/, /g/, /l/, /m/, /s/ Spelled ‘ck’, ‘bb’, ‘dd’, ‘ff ’, ‘gg’, ‘ll’, ‘mm’, ‘ss’
children.teaser: Students will learn about double-letter spellings

children.title: Sounds /k/, /n/, /p/, /r/, /t/, /z/ Spelled ‘cc’, ‘nn’, ‘pp’, ‘rr’, ‘tt’, ‘zz’;The Sound /k/ Spelled ‘c’, ‘ck’, ‘k’, ‘cc’
children.teaser: Students will focus on double letter spellings and /k/ spelled 'ck' 'k' and 'cc'

children.title: Review Sister Sounds /s/ and /z/; Tricky Words: was, when, why
children.teaser: Students will continue to review sister sounds

children.title: Grammar: Nouns
children.teaser: Students will spend time reading "The Flag Shop," practicing their decoding.

children.title: Question Mark; Tricky Words: where, which, what
children.teaser: Students will learn about question marks and tricky words beginning with "wh"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students will review, reading "Which is the Best?"

children.title: Quotation Marks; Tricky Words: here, there
children.teaser: Students will review punctuation marks and read "The Bus Stop"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students will learn "The Alphabet Song" and read, in small groups, "On the Bus"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students practice with tricky words and partner read "The Man in the Black Hat"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students continue to practice with tricky words and partner read "The Man in the Kilt"

children.title: Five Vowel Sounds
children.teaser: In Unit 2, we introduce five vowel sounds and the most common (or least ambiguous) spelling for each sound.

children.title: Vowel Digraph ‘ee’
children.teaser: Students work with medial sounds and listen to a demonstration story

children.title: Tricky Words; Nouns
children.teaser: Students work on noun identification and sound spelling review

children.title: Vowel Digraph ‘a_e’
children.teaser: Students work with vowel digraph a_e and reread "Grans Trips" or "The Pet"

children.title: Review Vowel Digraphs
children.teaser: Students review vowel digraphs and being a new story

children.title: Tricky Words
children.teaser: Student work with tricky word cards and continue reading "Wong from Hong Kong"

children.title: Vowel Digraph ‘i_e’
children.teaser: Students are introduced to a new sound and do pair reading from "The Swim Meet"

children.title: Nouns
children.teaser: Students work with identifying proper nouns and read about the coral reef

children.title: Vowel Digraph ‘o_e’
children.teaser: Students work with vowel digraphs after teacher modeling.

children.title: Tricky Words
children.teaser: Students work with nouns, tricky words, and rereading "Gran"

children.title: Nouns
children.teaser: Students work with sounds, tricky words, and "Bug Glass" in small groups after teacher modeling

children.title: Nouns
children.teaser: Students identify nouns that name places and partner read "The Tape"

children.title: Vowel Digraph ‘u_e’
children.teaser: Students work with vowel digraph u_e and begin "Fuzz and Mel" with teacher demonstration

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work with nouns, digraph dictation, and apply it to small group reading work

children.title: Tricky Words; Review
children.teaser: Students work with tricky words and revisit "Gran"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work with tricky words, spelling, and grammar and listen to "King and Queen"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Spelling Bee and review of tricky words and grammar

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students partner read "The Trip West"

children.title: Review/Assessment
children.teaser: Students take a comprehension assessment

children.title: Review/Assessment
children.teaser: Students take a grammar assessment and reread from "Gran"

children.title: New Vowel Sounds and Spellings
children.teaser: Students work with five new vowel sounds and the common spellings for each sound, as well as practice their learning in decodable texts with specific emphases on those sounds.

children.title: Sound /oo/ Spelled ‘oo’
children.teaser: Students work on spelling words and a family letter

children.title: Tricky Word because; Planning a Fictional Narrative
children.teaser: Students work on spelling, dictations, tricky words, and fiction

children.title: Drafting a Fictional Narrative
children.teaser: Students write a draft of a fictional narrative and continue partner reading

children.title: Editing a Fictional Narrative
children.teaser: Students edit their narrative and focus on short vowel sounds

children.title: Sound /oo/ Spelled ‘oo’
children.teaser: Students are assessed on spelling. They also do review of tricky words.

children.title: Planning and Drafting a Book Report
children.teaser: Students learn new spelling words, and begin planning and drafting a book report

children.title: Tricky Spelling ‘oo’; Editing a Book Report
children.teaser: Students review spelling and introduce tricky spelling, as well as editing their book reports

children.title: Identifying Verbs; Publishing a Book Report
children.teaser: Students write their final copy and read "The Two Mules" in their small groups

children.title: Sound /ou/ Spelled ‘ou
children.teaser: Students are introduced to a new sound and continue with "The Two Mules" to practice that sound

children.title: Tricky Word down; Identifying Verbs
children.teaser: Students are assessed on spelling and learn about tricky verbs

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work on spelling words and review

children.title: Sound /oi/ Spelled ‘oi’
children.teaser: Students work on vowel spellings and read in small group "The Bag of Coins" to practice the /oi/

children.title: Identifying Present- and Past-Tense Verbs
children.teaser: Students review sounds and reread Stories and Fables.

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work with digraphs and reread from the Stories and Fables

children.title: Sound /aw/ Spelled ‘aw’
children.teaser: Students are assessed on spelling and the teacher introduces the /aw/ spelled 'aw'

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students review common and proper nouns, work with verbs, and read "The Dog and the Ox" as a full group

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work with digraphs and read "The Fox and the Grapes"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students practice with tricky words in the stories they have been reading

children.title: Word Recognition and Story Comprehension Assessments
children.teaser: Students are assessed on word recognition and read "The Fox and the Crane"

children.title: Spelling, Comprehension, and Word Reading
children.teaser: In this unit we introduce the sounds that are sometimes called the /r/-controlled vowel sounds and the most common spelling for each sound.

children.title: Sound /er/ Spelled ‘er’; Tricky Words Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday
children.teaser: Students are introduced to the sound using sound riddles

children.title: Contractions
children.teaser: Students work with vowel spellings, contractions, and "Meet Vern"

children.title: Contractions
children.teaser: Student work with contractions and reread "Meet Vern"

children.title: Sound /ar/ Spelled ‘ar’
children.teaser: Students work with the /ar/ sound and read "Things that Swim"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students review and are assessed on spelling

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students engage in vowel spelling review

children.title: Sound /or/ Spelled ‘or’; Two-Syllable Words
children.teaser: Students are introduced to two-syllable words

children.title: Tricky Words yesterday, today, tomorrow
children.teaser: Students practice with two-syllable words and tricky words

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students work with two-syllable words, identify nouns and verbs, and reread "Chimps" in small groups

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work with spelling and listen to a whole-group reading of "Mandrills"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work with present and past tense verbs

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students read "Things with Wings" and do vowel spelling review

children.title: Identifying Past-, Present-, and Future-Tense Verbs
children.teaser: Students work specifically with past, present and future tense verbs

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students continue to work with vowel sounds, two-syllable words and reread "Big Cats"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students are assessed on spelling and practice "Groundhogs"

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students work with "ed" and then whole-group read "The Reptile Room"

children.title: Adjectives
children.teaser: Students work with adjectives in addition to nouns and verbs

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students use adjectives and practice verb identification

children.title: Review
children.teaser: Students word-sort and partner read "Termite"

children.title: Planning a Descriptive Paragraph
children.teaser: Students begin planning a descriptive paragraph

children.title: Drafting a Descriptive Paragraph
children.teaser: Students draft a descriptive paragraph using what they have learned about nouns, adjectives and verbs.

children.title: Planning and Researching a Descriptive Paragraph
children.teaser: Students plan and research using informational text

children.title: Drafting a Descriptive Paragraph
children.teaser: Students draft their writing and read in small groups "Cranes and Spoonbills"

children.title: Editing a Descriptive Paragraph
children.teaser: Students will edit their descriptive writing using what they have learned about grammar and format

children.title: End-of-Unit Assessment
children.teaser: Students will do the assessment and do some reading.

children.title: Mid-Year Assessment
children.teaser: Students will be assessed on reading comprehension and word reading in isolation

children.title: Mid-Year Assessment
children.teaser: The assessment will continue around reading comprehension and word reading

children.title: Mid-Year Assessment
children.teaser: Students will be assessed on reading comprehension and word reading in isolation

children.title: Spelling Alternatives and Advancing the Code
children.teaser: Students move from the clear spelling of sounds to the more advanced codes.

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘p’ and ‘pp’ for /p/
children.teaser: Students work with plural noun and the sound for /p/

children.title: Tricky Word how
children.teaser: Students work with the tricky word "how" and read as a whole group "A Letter from Kate"

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘b’ and ‘bb’ for /b/
children.teaser: Students work with the sister sounds /b/ and /p/

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘c’, ‘k’, ‘cc’, and ‘ck’ for /k/
children.teaser: Students work with spellings for /k/ and apply that to "In the Cave"

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘c’, ‘k’, ‘cc’, and ‘ck’ for /k/
children.teaser: Students are assessed for spelling with attention to the /k/ sound

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘ch’ and ‘tch’ for /ch/
children.teaser: Students are introduced to spellings for /ch/ and "The Coin Shop"

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘g’ and ‘gg’ for /g/
children.teaser: Students work with spellings for /g/ and "The Coin Shop"

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘j’, ‘g’, and ‘ge’ for /j/
children.teaser: Students are working with /j/ and partner reading for "You Never Can Tell"

children.title: Tricky Spelling ‘g’ for /g/ and /j/
children.teaser: Students work with the tricky spelling 'g' and "The Offer"

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students review spellings and work in small groups on "The Campsite"

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘t’, ‘tt’, and ‘ed’ for /t/
children.teaser: Students are introduced to spellings for /t/ and the difference between statements, questions, and exclamations

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘d’, ‘dd’, and ‘ed’ for /d/; Tricky Word stagecoach
children.teaser: Students work with sister sounds /t/ and /d/ and "Jack's Tale" in small groups

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘f’ and ‘ff ’ for /f/
children.teaser: Students work with /f/ should and continue with difference between statements, questions, and exclamations

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘v’ and ‘ve’ for /v/; Tricky Word picture
children.teaser: Students work with /f/ and /v/ and alternative spellings

children.title: Introduction to Opinion Writing
children.teaser: Students are assessed on spelling and then are introduced to opinion writing

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘r’, ‘rr’, and ‘wr’ for /r/; Planning and Drafting an Opinion Paragraph as a Class
children.teaser: Students work on planning and drafting the opinion piece as a class

children.title: Planning and Drafting an Opinion Paragraph Independently
children.teaser: Students work on planning and drafting the opinion piece independently, and also read "Bone Man"

children.title: Editing an Opinion Paragraph
children.teaser: Students work on sentence building and editing

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘l’ and ‘ll’ for /l/
children.teaser: Students continue with sentence building and focus on alternatives for /l/

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students review tricky words, adjectives, and partner read "Two good things..."

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students review two-syllable words and partner read "The Big Dig"

children.title: End-of-Unit Assessment
children.teaser: Students are assessed on word recognition and grammar

children.title: Spelling Alternatives for Consonant Sounds
children.teaser: In this unit students continue the work they began in the last unit by introducing or reviewing a number of spelling alternatives for consonant sounds.

children.teaser: Students begin spelling word work and are introduced to the Personal Narrative

children.teaser: Students work with the tricky spelling 'c' and plan a class personal narrative

children.title: Practice; Drafting a Class Personal Narrative
children.teaser: Students work as a class to draft a personal narrative

children.title: Spelling Alternatives ‘ce’ and ‘se’ for /s/; Planning and Drafting Student Personal Narratives
children.teaser: Students are introduced to spelling alternatives for /s/ and begin planning and drafting personal narratives

children.title: Practice; Editing and Publishing Personal Narratives
children.teaser: Students work on editing and publishing their narratives

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students read as a whole group "Mister Spencer and the Rabbits"

children.title: Replacing Nouns with Pronouns
children.teaser: Students work with nouns and pronouns and do small group reading

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students work with tricky spelling 'g' and review alternatives for /j/

children.teaser: Students work with nouns and pronouns, then small group reading of "Ants"

children.title: Spelling Alternative ‘kn’ for /n/

children.teaser: Students do a word sort and small group rereads of "The Yard Sale"

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students work with tricky words and pronoun review

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students work with small groups to read "Dark Clouds and Wind"

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students work to build sentences with adjectives and prepositions

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students take a spelling assessment, review plural nouns, and partner read "The Visit"

children.title: Spelling Alternative ‘wh’ for /w/
children.teaser: Students work with alternatives to spelling for /w/ and read "The Soccer Game" in small groups

children.title: Review and Practice
children.teaser: Students partner read "Supper"

children.teaser: Students work with alternative spellings for /ng/ and read "Grace the Performer" in small groups

children.teaser: Students work with tricky spelling 'n'  and continue with "Grace the Performer"

children.teaser: Students read "The Frog Jumping Contest" and review pronouns

children.teaser: Students work with root words and endings as well as reading in small groups

children.teaser: Students work with vowel digraphs and small group reading of "Buster the Pig"

children.teaser: Students are assessed on word recognition and small group read "The Harvest"

children.teaser: Students are assessed on story comprehension

children.teaser: Students will continue with the advanced code while focusing on spelling alternatives for vowel sounds.

children.teaser: Students work with alternative spellings for /ae/

children.teaser: Students read as a whole group "Martez, Martez, Martez"

children.teaser: Students review grammar and read "Martez, Martez, Martez" in small groups

children.teaser: Students work with noun-verb agreement and read "Dinner with Kay"

children.teaser: Students work with noun-verb agreement and reread "The Red Dish"

children.teaser: Students review punctuation and partner read "Better than the Best"

children.teaser: Students take a spelling assessment and then work with punctuation

children.title: Grammar: Building Sentences with Conjunctions
children.teaser: Students will small group read "The Vote"
